wikipedia_page.main:
Thomas Gunston Calhoun (1795 – 6 September 1861) was an English cricketer who played for Kent. He was born in Chichester and died in Goring-by-Sea.
Calhoun made a single first-class appearance, in 1827, against Sussex. Playing as a tailender he scored just a single run in the two innings in which he batted, in a seven-wicket defeat.
